name: Pale Priestess
Description: Loretta, the pale priestess appreciates the elven wines at the inn...

theScene: Arriving back at the town, the two of you head towards the inn, eager for some relaxation after the adventurous expedition.

Finding a remote table for two, you and Loretta exchange small talk as you make yourself comfortable. A waiter approaches your table, looking a little uncomfortable under the lecherous glances of a group of elves at the next table. Without so much as a glance at the menu, Loretta places her order.
I would like a small bottle of elf wine.
Taking your order next, the waiter departs, and Loretta places her arms on the table, resting her chin in her hands as she looks at you with a flushed smile.
I don't hold my drinks well... But I am surprisingly resilient against aphrodisiacs, so the wine works well for me.
The two of you start chatting, merrily returning to the adventuring conversation you started at the caverns. The drinks arrive soon enough, livening up the conversation even more.
You know, I still can't wrap my head around all this... sex fighting.
I vastly prefer men, you see... So playing with all those monster girls is a bit strange to me.
At this point, I'm unsure if I can keep up with this strange adventuring life. This isn't what I expected at all...
You point out that she seems to have adapted at least partially, judging by her outfit.
Oh, yes... This was actually the first thing I did to try and... get in the role, so to speak.
My old robes were quite conservative. Even Lillian would find no fault with them...

The date goes on. Loretta is pleasant company, easily keeping the conversation going. Your initial impression about her being a reserved person fades away partially, though it may just be the alcohol talking...
Recalling her earlier invitation, you decide to spend some time with the pretty priestess and approach her table.
As you sit across from her, Loretta places her arms on the table, resting her chin in her hands, and looks at you with a flushed smile.

Oh, yes... This was actually the first thing I did to try and... get in the role, so to speak.
My old robes were quite conservative. Even Lillian would find no fault with them...

Deciding to spend some time with Loretta, you make your way towards her table. She looks a little bored, regarding her wine glass with an absent gaze.
She smiles as you sit across from her, perking up just a bit.
I am. Originally, I come from one of the conservative... you might even say... {i}repressed{/i} branches of the Church.
I was pretty thoroughly disillusioned about the whole purity teachings during my time in Adventum.
But even that didn't prepare me for how Lucidia really was...
As I mentioned before, mostly with erotic magic. I am sure Archmage Elizabeth could tell you more, if you're not already a mage yourself.
While many find my healing magic somewhat... pleasant, it is not intense enough to really work in a fight.
Thankfully, I was always good at all kinds of magic, so it wasn't too hard to learn some new tricks.
Though honestly speaking, I don't think I'll stand a chance against any {i}really{/i} strong monsters like this...
Loretta grows oddly silent at your question, her gaze growing really focused, almost as if she's thinking really hard and not just reminiscing...
Feng... I think. You know, the unfortunate wolf girl from the Willpower Temple? Have you met her?
You respond with a nod, then point out that it's a little odd, given that Feng is weak to holy magic.
Ah, well... You know how it can be sometimes, right? Sometimes, it's not so... easy.
Loretta brushes aside her veil and turns her head, showing off one of her ears.
Oh, good eye. Few people notice, but you are right. I was even mistaken for an elf, once. Imagine that...
Having a better look, you realize that while her ears are indeed a little sharp-looking, they are much shorter than elven ears and have a different, far more human-like shape.
So you're really not a monster?
No! It's just how I was born.
Loretta cocks her head in confusion.

'Sorry for leaving early. There is something I need to tell you next time.    -Loretta.'
Deciding to spend some time with Loretta, you make your way towards her table. She looks a little wistful, regarding her surroundings with an absent gaze.
When you sit across from her, she frowns, her features growing unexpectedly tense.
Sensing that something is amiss, you tense up as well. Loretta doesn't look her usual languid and relaxed self.
I want to tell you something... But not here.
Will you come with me out of town? The Mystic Forest should be good enough.
Well... I need to show you something... and I don't want to do it here.
Please, you have to believe me. I understand it sounds strange and suspicious, but I promise nothing will happen to you.
She gets up from the table and you follow suit. Exiting the merry environment of the bar, the two of you navigate the night streets, heading towards the town gate.
We won't have to go far, just a little bit into the Forest.
You nod and keep following Loretta. She doesn't say anything else and keeps moving, a couple of steps ahead of you, only the sound of her heels clacking on stone filling the night air.

The silence is awkward, but quickly enough, the two of you arrive in the forest. The priestess keeps walking silently, deeper and deeper into the forest. Just as you worry that you will start running into elf traps soon, Loretta finally stops and turns to face you.
... There is something you need to know.

...You really guessed it at random...? Yes...

EventText.NameOfScene: 'It wasn't that hard to figure out...'

theScene: The truth is... I am a monster.
As Loretta's normally pale blue eyes become redder and redder, you take a step back involuntarily. You can see her fangs now... Her presence is quite...
A vile, lying old hag! I tricked you! I stopped being an adventurer a hundred and fifty years ago!
... quite scary, almost terrifying... But she also looks so sad right now...
It isn't! I came to those Caverns with the intent to lie and deceive!
And I say that's okay. I'm not mad at you.
Y-you... You have every right to hate me now. I lied, tricked, and seduced you! How can you say it's okay?!
Well... You didn't actually do anything bad to me. No harm, no foul, right?
B-but... I planned to... I wanted to enthrall you, to feed on your blood...
But you didn't, right? And in the end, you decided to stop and tell me the truth.|n|... And hey, the sex was pretty amazing.

Loretta squeezes your hand and breaks down crying...

Loretta sobs quietly. It takes her a moment, but gingerly and shyly, she wraps her arms around you.
I see... you don't hate me. Thank Goddess...
Loretta lets out a heartfelt sigh of relief... then breaks down crying...
Did you like doing it? Lying, tricking me?
Then apologize. Say that you're sorry, instead of posing as an evil monster.
Dumbfounded at being lectured, the vampire looks down and articulates in a shaky voice.
Then a dam seems to break in her and she bursts into tears.
It takes Loretta a moment to calm down. She still looks shaken and somewhat embarrassed over her outburst, but far more relaxed than she was before. And mostly, she looks relieved.
I... I suppose I will be going now. I... need to think. But I'll be back soon. Come meet me, okay...? At the usual place.
For now, I need a moment...
Loretta takes a step away and dissolves into a flock of bats which take off into the night...
You have to say you didn't actually expect that.
Chewing over what just happened, you walk back to town. Surprisingly, you don't encounter any errant monster girls on your way, and make it safely back to the square.
Unable to stand her deathly presence, or perhaps disgusted by all the deceiving, you stumble a step away.
Turning tail, you start running away from her, unable to look at her any longer. Memories of the moments you spent together flash in your mind, and only bring pain.
You run and run, not stopping until you make it back to town, out of breath and with a queasy feeling in your stomach.
You think you saw her crying as you ran... but you don't want to think about it. Repressing a shiver, you walk back to the town gates.
You most likely won't ever see her again.
|f|ChangeImageLayer|/|Expression|/|Languid|n|I'll be around here at night, so come see me again sometime.

Deciding to spend some time with your vampire friend, you make your way towards her table. Loretta looks a little bored, regarding her wine glass with an absent gaze.
She smiles broadly as you sit across from her. Paying attention, you notice you can see her fangs... And you realize that it makes her smile all the more sincere.

Deciding to spend some time with your vampire friend, you make your way towards her table. Loretta looks a little bored, regarding her wine glass with an absent gaze.
She smiles softly as you sit across from her, leaning over the table for a quick peck.

Yes... I was a priestess and the healer of an adventuring group, a hundred and fifty-seven years ago.
We were doing pretty well. A strong group, led by a talented Hero. Everyone thought we would reach the reigning Demon Queen...
And then we fought a... a vampire. My Sire.
Though 'fought' is a strong word... At first, she played innocent, and seduced the Hero. She gave us a place to rest. Then...
She used him to wipe us out. And then she... bit me. And I ceased being human.

I hated her... But only at first, you know? The years went by, giving me time to think and get used to my new condition. I was stuck with a new role, in a new society... And she was... accommodating. She gave me help that I couldn't refuse.
As I lived with the newfound... urges, I understood her more. In the end, she was living by her own principles, and constantly struggling with truly insatiable desires.

In fact, more than her, what I truly grew to hate were human men. Especially him... The 'Hero'. I never forgave him. He gave up himself, his goals and all of us! For pleasure. He claimed he 'fell in love' with the enemy...|n|He is still one of her... husbands.
I know that sounds a little backwards... From a human point of view, we were both victims of an evil vampire, weren't we...?
... But after all, I am not a human.
All those 'heroes'... so entitled, so self-serving... So boastful, and yet ultimately slaves to such base instincts...

As Loretta speaks, her gaze goes to an adventurer being hoisted by a minotaur. As the monster girl triumphantly walks upstairs with her prize over her shoulder, the man giggles lustfully, his erect cock in full display.

The undead priestess lets out a scornful 'Tsk.' as she returns her attention to you, and you can't help but feel fear wash over you as her gaze bores into you before her expression changes radically, her eyes returning to a tranquil blue in the space of a heartbeat.
I came here... looking for a man. I could never find one, with my unrealistic standards, unfortunate baggage and... my desires.
Oh, no... no. That's not actually that bothersome.
What I mean is that... I hate men who give in to pleasure too easily.
And what's even worse... I love it when they do. Sexually, I mean. It is exciting to me, when they break. And yet I will hate them for it.

You know, that thing back at the cave? The whole 'I'm in a bind, help me out.'? I actually let myself be a little conceited.
My intent was to test men... To see how they would act on their adventure... if they would remind me of the 'Hero' failure.
You were the first I came across and I hit the jackpot.♪
{i}Ahem.{/i} Sorry to put it that way... And I feel bad about it in retrospect. 'Testing' someone by deceiving them wasn't a fair thing to do.

I'm glad things turned out differently. You are a great man, and even found it within yourself to forgive me. So of course I would love you.

I should clarify. When I say 'love', I don't mean a romantic infatuation, but an extreme opposite of the disdain I normally feel towards men. We just met recently, and believe it or not, my views on romance remained largely human-like despite my transformation.
In retrospect, any notion of 'normal' romance between us sounds ridiculous... given how I started our relationship.

The fact we're already having this conversation right now... it really serves to demonstrate how my careless words and actions keep leading me far away from the dreamlike, gentle romance I would've liked to experience.

But this isn't a cover or cosplay or a mockery... I am still pretty devout, you know?
The Goddess never abandoned me, even when I became... quite unholy.
I still pray, donate and can even perform some of the rituals. My holy magic is real, too.
Although her blessings make my skin tingle...
But yes, in the end, I never gave up on my calling. In a sense, my faith is all I have from my old life. I am glad to devote myself to the Goddess. Her presence is really... comforting.
And nowadays I feel her stronger than ever.♪
Ah yes, it is one of the... kinder ways we vampires use to {i}feed{/i} nowadays.
As you surely know, physical harm is currently prevented by the Demon Queen's barrier. Of course, this means that our fangs can no longer draw blood from people.
But we still need to drink blood. It is essential to our survival.
Thankfully, as it turned out, it is possible to bite people who consent, or those who want to be bitten in the first place.

Originally, to make a thrall, vampires would share their blood and perform various rituals to enslave a man. But the tradition fell out of practice, especially now that mixing blood isn't as easy as before, due to the barrier.
So today, 'enthralling' is just a fancy word for powerful charm spells, which most vampires are capable of.
It makes feeding easier, and a far more pleasant experience. Which also means it is much easier to get someone to agree to it.
It is, actually! You can't charm someone to do something they are vehemently opposed to.
Someone who is truly repulsed by a vampire or her actions cannot be turned into a thrall, no matter how much charm magic you fill them with.
You nod and, seeing she has no more to say on the subject, you point out that she mentioned other ways of feeding.
There are many. One of the more popular ones is simply overwhelming a human with pleasure, making them beg for more, then demand blood in exchange for more pleasure.
Mostly favored by vampires looking for a one-night thing, to slake the thirst. It feels quite hollow emotionally.
